newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Northwest gasoline eases, distillates steady.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Northwest gasoline eases, distillates steady.

text.p: U.S. Northwest gasoline prices eased and distillates were steady on Friday in reaction to sluggish California markets and rumours of short supplies.
Traders said Seattle values remained in line with stagnant California gasoline prices, which saw CARB grades flat and conventionals half a cent higher late on Friday.
Regular unleaded gasoline was assessed at 68-69 cents a gallon, down one cent from Thursday.
Premium was pegged seven cents higher than regular.
Jet fuel was unchanged from Thursday, ranging from 73-74 cents a gallon, while low-sulphur diesel firmed two cents, on rumours of tighter supply after some problems at Northwest refinery units.
Heavy fuel oils were notionally firmer, with 180 CST at $104/105 per tonne, rising with higher world prices, while 380 CST firmed to $97/100 per tonne.
